Authors:
Zuo-Peng Liu, Sheng-Nan Zhang, Ratchadawan Cheewangkoon, Qi
Zhao, Jian-Kui Liu
Title:
Crassoascoma gen. nov. (Lentitheciaceae, Pleosporales):
Unrevealing Microfungi from the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China
Keywords:
2 new taxa; Dothideomycetes; high-elevation; Phylogeny;
Taxonomy
Abstract:
We are participating in an investigation of microfungi
associated with woody plants on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau (QTP). Four
collections associated with Potentilla fruticosa were obtained from
Gansu and Qinghai provinces in China. Morphologically, they line well
with Lentitheciaceae in having subglobose to globose ascomata with brown
setae on the papilla but can be distin-guished from other genera by its
superficial, globose, black, thick-walled ascomata, and fusiform,
hyaline (rarely pale brown), 1-septate ascospores, surrounded by an
entire mucilaginous sheath. The phylogenetic analyses based on a
combined SSU, ITS, LSU and TEF1-Î± sequence data showed that four
isolates formed a monophyletic clade among the genera of
Lentitheciaceae, and present as a distinct lineage (sister to
Darksidea). Therefore, we introduce a new genus Crassoascoma, with C.
potentillae as the type to accommodate these taxa. Detailed description
and illustration are pro-vided, and the establishment of new taxa is
justified with morphology and phylogenetic evidence.
